Vocabularies.Definition: a. containing (too) much water 含水多的，潮湿的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The soup is watery.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  a fictional being from outer space 外星人 a. of or coming from outside the Earth	 地球外的，宇宙的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  NASA has started a 10-year search for extraterrestrial intelligence.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.    a person who always thinks that what is going to happen will be bad 	悲观论者，悲观主义者 pessimistic   a.
v.  move to and fro across 交叉往返（于）
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Telephone wires crisscross the street.

Vocabularies.Definition: (fml)   because of
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The house isn't really suitable for an old person on account of all those stairs.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.    县治安官;行政司法长官
n.   the second most important person in a particular organization 副职，副手
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  A deputy was appointed in case the manager became ill.

Vocabularies.Definition: spend time and effort preparing; produce or develop gradually 准备，整理；逐步发展
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The head of the department asked me to work up some sample compositions and give them to the students.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  money paid for the support of a government 税，税款	vt. impose a tax on 对……征税
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  They're putting up the tax on cigarettes.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  大农场
n.    退职金； 养老金；抚恤金
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   The employees in many companies put aside money for their retirement pensions.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt.   make (a person) unable to use his/her body properly 使残废
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   In that country, the poor and disabled are left to starve on city streets.

Vocabularies.Definition: n., a.   退伍军人（的）； 富有经验的（人） e.g.  By 1955 more than 2 million veterans of World War II had used the government financial aid to go to college.
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.

Vocabularies.Definition: a.   difficult to understand or deal with  复杂的，难解的 e.g.  The new computer is too complicated even for a skilled operator to handle.
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.    a tax collector 税务员
a.   easy to talk to or deal with; friendly  可接近的，平易近人的，亲切的
n.  碟状物；飞碟；茶碟 e.g.  cups and saucers
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.

Vocabularies.Definition: (infml)    stop working, usu. at the end of a day e.g.  If I get this paper done I'll knock off early today.
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.

Vocabularies.Definition: (infml)  go to bed e.g.  Louise was so tired that she hit the sack soon after supper.
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt., n.  swear 诅咒，咒骂 e.g.  They were waiting impatiently for the bus at the bus station, cursing the delay.
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.

Vocabularies.Definition: examine the details of, check; study or review carefully 	仔细检查，核对；研究，考虑；温习 e.g.  Go over the textbook before you take the examination.
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.   列；栏，专栏；（圆）柱 e.g.  She added up the first column of figures and entered the total at the bottom.
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.    火箭 e.g.  They have launched a rocket to the planet Venus.
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt.  open wide, cause to stick out; annoy  使突出，张大；打扰	n.  虫子，臭虫；毛病，故障
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The naughty kid from next door put a frog in my mailbox, which really bugged me.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.    面色，肤色
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  She had short brown hair and a pale complexion.

Vocabularies.Definition: ad.   for each one 每人，每个，各
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  He found the shells at a garage sale priced at 35 cents apiece.

Vocabularies.Definition: a., ad. similar(ly) 相同的（地），相似的（地）
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Teachers are required to treat all their students alike.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.   the act of watching attentively 观察，观测
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Observation plays an essential part in the traditional Chinese medical practitioner's diagnoses.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. a particular place; the position of sth. 地点；位置
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  People living in this locality complain of traffic noises disturbing them at night.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt.   set apart; cut off from others 使隔离，使孤立
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  When I'm angry, I find it best to isolate myself from other people for a little while.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt.   take over and use as one's own; take into one's family and make legal son or daughter 采用；收养
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Some immigrants discarded their old customs and adopted American ways.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.   a manner, way or method of doing 方式，模式，样式
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  You'll have to change your mode of life once you have a baby.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.    the way that sb./sth. looks; an act of coming into sight 外貌；出现
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Women's magazines were full of ideas on how to make the best of one's appearance.

Vocabularies.Definition: be attracted by; like or prefer   对……有好感；喜欢
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Many young people go for pop music.

Vocabularies.Definition: v.  shut and open the eyes quickly; flash on and off 眨（眼）；闪烁
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Staring for hours at a computer screen dries out the eyes as people blink less.

Vocabularies.Definition: without worrying about or taking account of  不顾；不管
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Medicare, another form of federal health insurance, pays a large part of the medical bills for the disabled, regardless of age.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 国籍；民族
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Her father is an American. Her mother is an Italian. What nationality is she?

Vocabularies.Definition: willing to help sb. 愿意为某人效劳
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   If you need any help, I'm at your service.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  安排
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The company tried to make flexible work arrangements so that it would make the best of all its employees.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.     组织，机构，团体
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The European Union, the biggest US trade partner, prepared a protest to the World Trade Organization (WTO).

Vocabularies.Definition: a.   greatest in power, rank or degree	最高的；极度的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The Supreme Court meets in Washington, D.C., and the other federal courts are located in cities throughout the United States.

Vocabularies.Definition: visit someone at their house
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Halfway through the party, a neighbor came around to complain about the noise.

Vocabularies.Definition: int.  (used to express anger, impatience and disgust) 见鬼，该死 n. 地狱，苦境
allow one to be by oneself; allow sb. or sth. to remain untouched or unchanged  不打扰；听其自然
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  It's useless to talk to her since she is so upset; just leave her alone.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. nonsense; rubbish 废话；垃圾，废物
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Peter was talking a lot of garbage about education.

Vocabularies.Definition: v.  raise or lift; rise up 举起；升起
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  They had to heave the piano onto the stage.

Vocabularies.Definition: (also wits) n. quick understanding, intelligence 智力，才智，智慧
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  He lacked the wit to respond in time.

Vocabularies.Definition: (infml)   act as if one were; pretend to be 假装；装扮作
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The old man made like a monkey to amuse the children.

Vocabularies.Definition: cause (sb.) to fall to the ground by pushing or hitting them; destroy and remove (sth.) 撞倒；拆毁
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The driver was in serious trouble for knocking down a pedestrian on a pedestrian crossing.

Vocabularies.Definition: see for a moment  一眼看见，瞥见
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  I caught sight of her just as she turned the corner and disappeared.

Vocabularies.Definition: a.  bright 有光泽的，闪耀的，发亮的
disappear gradually 逐渐消失
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  As it was getting colder and colder, their enthusiasm for doing sports in the morning faded out.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  an inhabitant of the planet Venus 金星人
n. (infml)  a stupid person 笨蛋

Vocabularies.Word: Issac Asimov       伊萨克 · 阿西莫夫
Bart Cameron    巴特 · 卡默伦
Twin Gulch    特温加尔奇（城镇名）
the U.N. = the United Nations 联合国
Venice    威尼斯（意大利东北部港市）
